DOC.HEADLINE: WORLD IN BRIEF ; LITHUANIA ; LOW TURNOUT DOOMS ECONOMIC PROPOSAL
DOC.TEXT: A referendum on compensating citizens for suffering caused by the switch to a market_economy failed because the voter_turnout was too low.International economists had said approval of the referendum , which was opposed by the reformed Communist government and backed by the opposition , would be catastrophic for the Baltic nation . The Central Elections Center reported that only 35 % of voters had cast ballots just before polls closed . More_than half of registered voters needed to take_part for the referendum to be valid .
